page.title: 05FRISKNEY EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Unemployment is probably slightly higher than the national average (currently about 13%) About 50% of jobs are in farming (self-employed or employee) or in jobs connected with agricuture or horticulture. There is no industry. Casual work on the land is available in the growing season. A few people work in Skegness in the holiday period. About 15% of jobs are in recognised trades. There are few people in business, professional or administrative occupations. Apart from agriculture about 15% of people are self-employed. Over 75% of people live and work in the village. Despite the number of agricultural jobs there is a wide variety of others-actor, serving Merchant Navy Officer, wine shipper and merchant and night club worker.
